medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive leg weakness, recurrent falls, and anemia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 8 months prior to admission with fatigue on exertion and subjective leg weakness. Over the next 3 months, the distance he could walk decreased significantly, leading to frequent rests due to fatigue and leg weakness. Five months prior, intermittent hypoesthesias and paresthesias developed in the feet and the patient experienced a fall due to tripping over an object. Two days before admission, he fell while carrying groceries.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of atrial fibrillation, hypertension, gout, osteoarthritis of the knees, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and Barrettâ€™s esophagus. Roux-en-Y gastric bypass performed 6 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: Father and brother died of esophageal cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Divorced, lives alone, works as a store manager, increased alcohol consumption (6-7 glasses of wine nightly for 3 months).
